A new shooter set in the StarCraft universe is in the works at Blizzard, according to Bloomberg reporter Jason Schreier's book Play Nice, via Eurogamer. The project is headed up by Dan Hay, who worked various leading roles on Ubisoft’s Far Cry series, and also a 1999 CGI film starring Jim Belushi named “The Nuttiest Nutcracker”. The real-time strategy spinoff was also mentioned during an IGN podcast that aired yesterday.
Read more
articles.title: The ghost of StarCraft: Ghost endures as a new shooter set in the RTS universe is in the works at Blizzard

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
What exact percentage of unacknowledged irony is it when a digital game wants to sing the praises of paper-based art in the context of a story about fighting off a "blight" of digital creatures? If you were serious about that moral, Hirogami, you'd actually be printed on hammered-down treemulch. I decry thee, pretender! You're one of the very electronic critters you want me to battle. On the other hand, you do let me transform into an origami armadillo which can roll around like a pinball. Here's the announcement trailer.
 
Read more
articles.title: Print isn't dead, insists origami platformer Hirogami, in which you fight a digital Blight

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
I don't know why we haven't written about Mechabellum before now, but we haven't. Let's correct that. It's an autobattler in which you plonk down squads of stompy robots then watch them win or lose against your opponent's army based on the formations and upgrades you've chosen. After more than a year in Early Access, it's just released version 1.0.

 
Read more
articles.title: Strategy autobattler Mechabellum has hit 1.0 after over a year in Early Access

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Do I like citybuilders such as Cities: Skylines and SimCity 4, or do I simply like roadbuilders? I spend most of my time in both those games tweaking the network of roads and junctions that form the veins of my cities, after all, and attempting to solve traffic jams via public transport and simulation-expanding mods.

Enter Junxions, a traffic engineering game which focuses entirely on the simulation and construction of roads, railways, and pedestrian walkways, right down to the coding of the traffic lights. It's aiming for a 2025 release and you'll find its trailer below.

 
Read more
articles.title: Junxions is a traffic engineering sim where you can finally fix that junction near your house

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Indie publisher Hooded Horse have been on a roll of late, publishing wonderful strategy games like Manor Lords, Against The Storm and Cataclismo. Good news, then, that they're currently running a publisher sale over on Steam where those games and many others in their library are discounted.

 
Read more
articles.title: Hooded Horse is having a Steam publisher sale, with discounts on Manor Lords, Against The Storm and many more

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
During his tenure as the foremost newsperson of the 1980s, Atari's Paperboy faced many grievous challenges - squabbling drunks, swarms of bees, the actual Grim Reaper - and yet, day after day he answered the noble call of journalism, lashing his basket to his doughty BMX and daring the treacherously oblique suburbs of Reaganite America. 


Speaking as both a news editor and a former paperboy, who broke his mind and body hauling obese Sunday editions to the millionaire houses at the top of the valley, Paperboy is my role model. Or he would be if my role model weren't actually Steven Spielberg's Freakazoid. Paperboy's heyday has long since passed into history, however, and the business of journalism has changed beyond recognition. People don't read newspapers anymore, they just eat pizza. This, at least, is the condensed analysis offered by Food Boy, which launched this week on Steam.
 
Read more
articles.title: Food Boy wishes only to deliver pizza, but the twerkers won't let him

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Experimental, feature-length simulation game Apartment Story is not especially brilliant, but it does feature a home invasion that’s stressful in several, systemically tangible ways I’ve never quite felt in such a specific combination from a videogame before. It’s partly a story about mental health, partly about the absolute horror of not just managing a Sim but actually being one, and partly about seeing how many wanks and cheese sandwiches you can fit into a single morning. Yes, I washed my hands afterward. Ah, but after which?
Read more
articles.title: Apartment Story is a game about murder, loneliness, and the mental health benefits of straight up jorking it

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
You might remember Kara Stone as the developer of Ritual Of The Moon, a game about a banished witch that is played in bursts of five minutes a day, over the course of a lunar cycle. Alice B (RPS in peace) dedicated an article series to it back in 2019, summarising it as "a sad, quiet, meditative game about breathing and loneliness and drawing pictures in the stars". Stone's forthcoming Known Mysteries is a ritual of the sun, I guess. Slated for launch on 23rd October, it's the first of several, creatively low-carbon projects that will run off a custom, solar-powered server Stone has set up on her apartment balcony in Calgary, Canada.
 Read more
articles.title: Known Mysteries is a lo-fi climate fable that runs off a solar-powered server on its developer's balcony

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Wartorn sci-fi extraction shooter The Forever Winter has had a messy launch into early access. For those who don't know the game, this third-person helljaunt sees its players wandering through the battlefields of an endless conflict between three major world powers. Mechs stomp past you, ignoring you in favour of decimating enemy soldiers. Bug-like drones hover overhead, scanning for prey. And horrifying mommy harvesters scavenge bodies from the debris. As a collection of imagery, it's powerful stuff. As a game that you can play (with up to three pals) it is very rough, and not just around the edges. 
Read more
articles.title: The Forever Winter early access review: a messy extraction shooter that should have stayed in cover longer

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Bravely he stood, alone on his hill, unwavering in the face of backlash: Chrono Trigger should have just let Frog be a talking frog instead of being a knight turned into a frog. So, trash game. Fortunately, I can finally experience what it’s like to actually enjoy Chrono Trigger - Canadian Studio Riyo Games are making what they describe as a "spiritual successor". It’s called Threads Of Time, it’s "aided by legendary developers and composers from Japan who have helped define Xenoblade Chronicles, the Mana series and more," and it looks beautiful. Hop on over to the trailer below.
Read more
articles.title: Airships, dinosaurs, and robots meet in “spiritual successor to Chrono Trigger” RPG Threads Of Time

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Indie developers love making retro-styled games that look like PlayStation games you rented from Blockbuster and blitzed through in a feverish winter weekend. I'm glad, so here's another. Cold And Afraid is a murder mystery that aims to channel the 1990s with chunky characters and lots of lovely dithering. You play a detective out to stop a serial killer with a grisly pattern who's preying on the young women of an unnamed US city. On top of the obligatory tank controls, it aims to have "consequential dialogue choices" and a "Time Event system where you must meet certain people at specific times to forward different story threads". Ah, forgive me, you're here to see the chunky limbs. Here's a recent trailer that shows 'em.
Read more
articles.title: Cold And Afraid is a PS1-style murder mystery aiming to be "Law & Order by Squaresoft in 1999"

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
I reckon I've got quite a strong long term memory. For instance, I can recall that time I read Stoner on a backpacking trip through Italy and realising that I particularly like sad books. I can also recall the delicious taste of a Mars Delight chocolate bar. But my short term memory, whew. Yeah it's not so good. And the demo for Disposition, a liminal escape room game where you've got to remember how things are arranged in rooms, has hammered this point home.
Read more
articles.title: Disposition is an escape room game that tests whether you've got the memory recall of a goldfish

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
A year and a day after wonderful horror visual novel Slay The Princess first released, the promised Pristine Edition is arriving this October on the 24th. Like a very loud sticker on a very large bag of crisps, it promises to have “roughly 35%” more stuff in it. It’s a great game, and this sounds like the perfect time to pick it up, especially if you previously pirated it after the devs said they didn’t mind.
Read more
articles.title: Slay The Princess gets three new chapters and more when The Pristine Cut releases 24th October

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Resident Evil's awkward middle child, Resident Evil 3: Nemesis, is now available via GOG. It follows in the leaking, shambling footsteps of Residents Evil 1 and 2, which likewise oozed onto the platform in June and in August respectively.

 
Read more
articles.title: The original Resident Evil 3 is now available via GOG, following the arrivals of its predecessors

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
I don't know why it's throwback racing game Christmas, but it is. Parking Garage Rally Circuit came out September 20th, Golden Lap is out tomorrow, Victory Heat Rally is out October 3rd, and today - today brings the Steam Early Access release of #Drive Rally, an unfortunately hashtagged arcade racer trying to recapture the "spirit of the 90s".

 
Read more
articles.title: #Drive Rally is an arcade racer with forgiving physics out in Early Access now

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Metaphor: ReFantazio is either a high-fantasy Persona or a Shin Megami Tensei with cool fonts and a warm heart. Edwin dug its hybrid combat system, while James was moved by its mad libs monster design. It has an October 11th release date, but you don't have to wait until then to begin plotting it and you along these various axes. There's a demo you can play out now.

 
Read more
articles.title: Metaphor: ReFantazio, the high-fantasy RPG from Persona's designers, now has a playable demo

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The AssCreed faithful have waited a thousand years for a sequel set in feudal Japan, birthplace of ninjas and samurai. Woe unto ye dreamers of Ubisoft takes on Tenchu, for you must carry that candle for a little longer. Assassin's Creed Shadows has been delayed till next year. It was due to launch on 12th November 2024 - now, it will release on 14th February 2025.

 
Read more
articles.title: Assassin's Creed Shadows delayed to 2025 as Ubisoft try to recover from "softer than expected" Star Wars Outlaws launch

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Initially, Lorn’s Lure feels like an escape. A first-person spelunking sim, it takes place in a colossal, mournful extent of pipes and silos, ancient turbines and concrete cliffs, where emergency lighting and broken gantries form scrappy platforming routes into darkness. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Lorn's Lure is the anti yellow paint game, a joyful and maddening exploration of sunken megastructures

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Not technically an Indiescovery-type deal, this, as Edwin already called attention to breathless FPS Echo Point Nova back when the demo came out. The full game has just released, though, and as someone with such chronic Titanfall withdrawal that I’ll ingest anything with a decent wallrun, I’ve bought it, played it, and am here to tell you why it rocks.
Read more
articles.title: Titanfall and Tribes fans, don't miss skyfaring shooter Echo Point Nova

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
There is an absolute carkfest of a headline to be written here involving the words "head" "not" "enough" and "giving", but I am a journalist of grace and discretion, and will resist. Treyarch, Raven Software and Activision have popped up a note-to-players covering a range of improvements they're making to Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6 in the aftermath of August's beta. Specifically, they're tweaking the damage from bullets to the cranium, while trying to ensure that bullets to the cranium don't "significantly affect the consistency of time to kill".
 Read more
articles.title: Black Ops 6's developers are trying to work out how quickly headshots should kill you

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
If you're a nerd of a certain age, I apologise - that headline has probably caused you to rupture something in the wizened meat of your lower back, or the swampy catacombs of your cerebellum. If you aren't, let me explain: Zachtronics are or were a US-based video game developer founded in 2000 by Zach Barth, who put the studio on ice in 2022 and now works at Coincidence Games, a "flexible business framework" involving many former Zachtronics devs. Zachtronics have thrown together all kinds of things - Infiniminer, a block-builder from 2009, is probably the single greatest individual influence on Minecraft, while Eliza is a tremendous visual novel about AI chatbots and labour politics. But if there's a type of game they're known for, it's engineering puzzles and factory games.
 
Read more
articles.title: Would you play a Warhammer 40K factory game? Because Zachtronics almost made one

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Hey, remember Lost In Random? I reviewed it way back when and thought its Burtonesque setting and story were top notch, but it felt a bit reliant on samey fights. Moonhood Studios, founded by the creators of LIR, just announced The Midnight Walk at last night's PlayStation State Of Play showcase. And it looks to continue their appreciation of the dark and the strange. Case in point: it's a first-person adventure where you play as The Burnt One, who must steer a hideous pot creature through a twisted universe.
Read more
articles.title: The Midnight Walk sees you take a hideous ceramic lad on a grim claymated stroll

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
When you stare into the PlayStation Showcase, it stares also into you. Open world samurai action game Ghost Of Tsushima is getting a follow-up called Ghost Of Yotei, developers Sucker Punch have announced (or Ghost Of Yōtei, to include the technically-correct-but-annoying-to-reproduce-on-UK-keyboards diacritic that I will hereby drop to secure our sanity). It looks very picturesque and, like its predecessor, inspired by the Kurosawa showdowns of old. You can see for yourself in the trailer that acted as the finale of Sony's marketing show.
Read more
articles.title: Ghost Of Yotei announced as a samurai sequel to Ghost Of Tsushima

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Last year we reported horror game Alan Wake 2 would be getting a couple of expansions. We've already had one of these in the form of Night Springs. And Edwin noted that the other would probably be a crossover with Remedy's other big game, Control, featuring secret government agency, the Federal Bureau of Control. He was right, judging by the trailer shown at yesterday's PlayStation Showcase. 
The Lake House DLC is due out in October, and does indeed feature a facility run by the shady organisation whose job it is to keep powerful "altered items" from running amok. But it looks like somebody let a messed-up oil painting out of its cage.
Read more
articles.title: Alan Wake 2's next expansion is about a Control agent investigating a spooky painting - and it's out next month

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
We don’t usually cover Kickstarter projects here at chez Shotgun. Horace got burnt by a dodgy coffee maker once, had to regrow a few limbs, it’s a whole thing, the bear doesn’t like talking about it, etc. Anyway, rules are like Horace’s arms: they’re meant to be stretched, and also made of bear. MÖRK BORG Heresy Supreme is a grotty cheese dream of a 2D action game based on the popular tabletop RPG MÖRK BORG - a book so nice to just have on your shelf that I’m not even mad I accidentally bought a copy in Swedish. It’s fine. Makes it more metal.
Read more
articles.title: Legendary black metal TTRPG MÖRK BORG is getting a brutal, nightmarish side scroller

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Something magical occurred to me this morning: fit-flaying RPG Monster Hunter Wilds will be the first time I get to play a Monster Hunter game while also being a cat dad. It’s going to great! “What’s that, eh?!” I’ll say, pointing to a Doshaguma in a manner that might foolishly suggest I expect her to give a damn. “Mraow”, she’ll reply, knock over my coffee, then go back to sleep. “It’s you!” I’ll exclaim, pointing to the Palico I’ve spent six hours making look just like her. “That looks nothing like me, you odorous lummox,” she’ll insinuate with a cocked eyebrow, then go shout at an ant for a bit.
Ah well, at least I have videogames - this one is out on the 28th of Febwar, 2025. Here’s a trailer from last night’s Sony-me-doo:
Read more
articles.title: Monster Hunter Wilds releases 28th Feb 2025, which gives modders enough time to silence the uncanny talking Palicos

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
A week ago, while belabouring the nuances of Arco, I expressed a wish to play more bullet hell games with time freeze mechanics, the better to savour the intricacy of their projectile patterning. Now here's Moon Watch, a Vampire Survivors-ish pixelart shooter in which you have a watch that stops time when you stand still. Snug within that frozen instant, you're free to laugh in the gurning faces of the living dead while you idly choose and aim garlic grenades, stake launchers and bouncy ice comets.
Read more
articles.title: Try the demo for top-down undead slayer Moon Watch, in which time is movement and movement is garlic grenades

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Dead By Daylight developers Behaviour Interactive have announced that they're acquiring Red Hook, the creators of Darkest Dungeon. This is the same Behaviour Interactive who recently laid off a bunch of people, cancelled a game and closed a studio, Midwinter Entertainment, after bagging themselves a bunch of developers (the others are SockMonkey, Codeglue and Fly Studio) over the past two years. Darkest Dungeon is a horror game like DBD, so I guess the acquisition chimes from that perspective. All the same, my snap judgement is "yikes".

 
Read more
articles.title: Dead By Daylight developers Behaviour acquire Darkest Dungeon developers Red Hook

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
I don’t like to brag, but it turns out that running a museum is actually well easy. Within an hour of sitting down to play Two Point Museum at Gamescom last month, I was running a modest monthly profit, educating the masses about one-fifth of a dinosaur skeleton, and most importantly, had not ordered a single staff member to their death.
Read more
articles.title: Two Point Museum is all about turning expeditions into exhibitions, provided your staff survive

articles.author: Liam Richardson
articles.description:
Like a samurai poised patiently for an opening in their opponent’s defences, Shogun Showdown understands that focus and finesse are the means to delivering an impactful blow. This rare roguelike distils the genre down to its purest components, all in favour of amplifying its dizzying combat that plays gracefully with the concepts of positioning and patience. Highly refined, stylish and complex, Shogun Showdown is a delight.
Read more
articles.title: Shogun Showdown review: an exceptional roguelike that hits different

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
These apparitions and portents, Crystal Dynamics - what game are you playing now? It turns out the game they are playing is: a remaster of amazeballs vampire odyssey Legacy Of Kain: Soul Reaver, together with its less amazing but sturdy sequel. Said remaster project was rumoured earlier this year, when Sarafan scouts caught sight of a telltale plaque at San Diego Comic-Con. Consider that rumour strongly trending towards the status of a Real Thing, because Sony are in the habit of publishing Real Things, and they've just (accidentally, I guess) popped a bunch of screens and a trailer with a release date - 10th December 2024 - on the PlayStation website. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Soul Reaver remaster release date, screens and trailer leak via PlayStation and it all looks far too shiny

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Look out, it's Spiders. It's fun to write about Spiders, because you get to frighten people for a moment, before they realise you're talking about the game development studio, Spiders. They have just released GreedFall 2: The Dying Land into early access. For those who don't remember the first GreedFall, it was a colonial-styled RPG about landing on the magical shores of another continent and getting into scrapes with monsters and frontiersfolk. This time the story is furthering the fantasy Columbian exchange by putting you in the role of a native who's been uprooted against their will and taken to the "old world". The game's release comes against a backdrop of dissatisfaction in the studio. But workers have gained some concessions in talks. 
Read more
articles.title: Spiders release fantasy RPG GreedFall 2 in early access, as its frustrated workers are offered concessions

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
For years, a dangerous and charismatic game has evaded the grasp of many designers. Some say it doesn't exist, that no publisher would ever back it. I'm talking about the one city block RPG that Warren Spector has often mentioned. Sure, we've seen a few usual suspects already - Deus Ex Mankind Divided, Disco Elysium, even Else: Heart.Break - they all grimace in the line-up but nothing ever sticks. Now, out of the gloom of indie development, comes another perp ready to have his mugshot taken. Shadows Of Doubt is an open world detective sim that comes perilously close to being our guy. Its clothes, stature, gait, and fingerprints match the description of what Spector often describes. And yet, if you tilt your head, something is just a little off. The game isn't confined to one block. It's not an RPG precisely. And its simulation has plenty of bugs, jank, and unintentional comedy. But after all this time, in the absence of a smoking gun, shouldn't we just put this guy in the slammer and call the case closed? I say yes, let's. Officers! Arrest this game, it's brilliant. 
Read more
articles.title: Shadows Of Doubt review: a buggy yet brilliant detective sim of grand ambition

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
The in thing when it comes to dinosaur conversations now is this: "Yeah but did you know that they weren't all like, lizardy, but covered in feathers". You might want to chuck in that chickens are basically dinosaurs, because their feet have a "Triassic Flange", a (made-up) term that will make you sound authoritative. If you really want to showcase your knowledge, though, you may want to mention that dinosaurs may have actually fought with large swords lodged between their teeth. Dinoblade demonstrates this! And no, they haven't discovered swords alongside dinosaur fossils yet because palaeontologists have been unlucky thus far. "Soon", you tell them.
Read more
articles.title: Dinoblade has you duke it out as dinos with buster swords clamped between your gnashers

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
We liked Jusant, Don't Nod's clamber-upper masterpiece, and we also liked Banishers, their colonial ghost-busting action-adventure, but it seems that not enough people did. The company have posted a profit warning, reflecting an 11% decline in operating revenue for the first half of 2024. They've also "paused" two unannounced games in development, and altered other unannounced games to be more appealing to a "wider audience". Beyond that, they're considering "all possible options regarding our roadmap", which sounds just a touch ominous.  
 
Read more
articles.title: Don't Nod "pause" two game projects and "refocus" others following Jusant and Banishers sales disappointment

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
I'm not someone who's ever been on board with the "Can You Pet The Dog?" craze that swept and/or still sweeps video games. As a heartless individual, I am more concerned with whatever the dog's capable of: general savagery, a howl that replenishes my HP bar, letting me climb atop its glorious mane as it strides across the barren wastes. If it's none of these things, I would much rather have a shiny turret on spindly steel legs skitter besides me.
Nomada Studios have, incredibly, thrust their hands into my chest cavity and given me a blood-pumping mechanism. Having spent some time with upcoming action-platformer Neva (the game) and Neva (the dog from the game), I have to admit: I did enjoy petting Neva (the dog).
Read more
articles.title: Alright fine, Neva makes me want to pet the dog

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
This one’s a very simple build at the moment, but neat enough that I wanted to shout it out. Near Mint is a roguelike deckbuilder where you advance through a tower fighting slightly stronger iterations of the exact same skeleton. Ok, nothing too captivating so far. The twist comes from the cards: someone’s left them in their Oodie pouch, spilt BBQ sauce down it, then stuck it in the wash before taking the deck out. Now, all the cards have split apart into three pieces. It’s name-your-own-price on Itch here, and it’ll only take you a couple minutes to get acquainted, but I’ll explain the gist below. Gist is a good word. Satisfying to say. Gist.
Read more
articles.title: Near Mint is Slay The Spire but you’ve accidentally left your cards in the washing machine

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
While I’ve been known to enjoy a few of them in my time, I tend to view a lot of more mundane simulator games in the same way I view sports games: Looks fine, but I could do this stuff in real life, were I inclined and also social and also vaguely limber instead of owning a spine with roughly the flexibility of a rib n’ saucy Nik Nak.
Read more
articles.title: Buddy, if you’re only buying two lousy packs you can leave my TCG Card Shop Simulator store immediately

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Ever since Crimson Desert dropped that audacious trailer at Gamescom 2023, I’ve yearned to soak in its medieval Just Cause 2 vibes. It’s hard not to be moved by the exaggerated kineticism of it all – the magic-enhanced swordfights, the jumping off cliffs and turning into a flying shadow monster, the ability to drift horses. Yes. Yes!
I’m therefore somewhat unnerved to report that my enthusiasm has been tempered significantly by actually playing it. I’ve since used all the straws I’ve clutched at to spell out "It’s just a demo" on my floor, but the fear remains that Crimson Desert’s fantastical open-world exploration is going to be interrupted by regular bouts of twangy, unwieldy, unsatisfying combat.
Read more
articles.title: Crimson Desert, don’t let your slippery combat break my heart

articles.author: Caelyn Ellis
articles.description:
When playing a new Soulslike, there’s an element of translation involved while you figure out the language of the game. What are the upgrade materials called? What’s the equivalent of poison? What are experience points and checkpoints called, although you’re going to call them souls and bonfires anyway? I’ve done this many, many times, but on this occasion there was a surprising twist, one which would have notorious pearl-clutching racist HP Lovecraft spinning in his grave. Enotria: The Last Song’s arcane Soulslike language is actually just Italian.
Read more
articles.title: Enotria: The Last Song review: a straightforward, sunny Soulslike

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Disney Epic Mickey: Rebrushed is a remaster of Disney Epic Mickey, a cult classic 3D platformer first released a decade ago on the Wii. In the original you controlled the titular Mickey Mouse who, armed with a magical paintbrush (wieldable by waving the Wiimote about), could paint or rub out surfaces to solve puzzles. It was the work of Junction Studios led by Warren Spector, best known for being The Deus Ex Guy. No, sadly Mickey could not nano-augment his brush for better target acquisition, nor project laser-guided anti-tank rockets from his podgy white mitts.
And no, Rebrushed doesn't let him do anything of these either. Clearly a missed opportunity. But is it better nonetheless? With an updated look, some added secrets, more moves for Mickey, and controller/M&K support, I'd say longtime Mickey heads will adore this nostalgia trip. For total newcomers like me, I'd say it's a platformer that's certainly charming and clever and wonderfully experimental, but a bit flat in places too.
Read more
articles.title: Disney Epic Mickey: Rebrushed review: a faithful remaster of a paint-splashing platformer

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Valve are likely up to something hardware-related again, report NotebookCheck. Their next chunk of plastic and wires – following the Valve Index, Steam Deck and Steam Deck OLED – could swap PC gaming’s favoured x86 architecture for ARM, the type of processor favoured by the Nintendo Switch, Macs, and mobile phones.
Read more
articles.title: Valve’s ARM64 game testing points towards new Steam hardware, if vaguely

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Shirley Curry, aka the "Skyrim Grandma", is no longer posting gaming videos, she's told her viewers. An upcoming eye surgery is going to leave her recovering for some weeks and (more importantly to her) she is simply tired of playing games for an audience. 
"It isn't fun anymore," she says in a video. "I'm tired of it. I'm bored with it, bored to death with it. So I am making the decision now - totally, finally - I am not going to be making any more gaming videos and uploading them."
Read more
articles.title: The 88-year-old "Skyrim Grandma" isn't doing any more gaming videos (but will keep you updated on a quilt she's making)

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Spoilers throughout. TLDR: fun, generous, beautiful animation and cinematography. Worked mostly fine on my PC. I would not have given it the best narrative award if it were up against Gran Turismo 7. 
Writing of the frigid framing of Clockwork Orange’s atrocities, the film critic Pauline Kael asked: “is there anything sadder - and ultimately more repellent - than a clean-minded pornographer?” The lavishly directed and animated universe of God Of War Ragnarok is far from repellent, but it also feels spiritually squeegeed; a world of pulpy violence so chirpy and chaste as to strain belief that the scars that haunt its reformed anti-hero could have ever been inflicted there.
 
Read more
articles.title: God Of War Ragnarok review: calm down now, I’ve known this wolf for ninety seconds

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Earlier in the month, we learned that Stray and Neon White publisher Annapurna Interactive’s entire staff resigned after a dispute with boss Megan Ellison. Reported by Bloomberg as a disagreement over attempts to "spin off the video-game division as an independent entity," the details were nonetheless somewhat scant. A  new report from Rebekah Valentine at IGN has since shed some more light on the walkout, which reportedly involved “disagreements over the direction of the Interactive division, chaotic departures, communication breakdowns, and a perceived lack of leadership transparency.” It’s a thorough account of some messy events I recommend reading in full, but here’s a brief rundown.
Read more
articles.title: Annapurna Interactive has "splintered into two groups, both of which are now working to pick up the pieces" says new report

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Utne se i mistr tesař, jak víme. Tentokrát to nezvládla Mozilla, která se z pozice síly pustila do křížku s vývojářem oblíbeného doplňku uBlock Origin v odlehčené verzi Lite / Manifest v3.
articles.title: Mozilla šla po krku rozšíření uBlock Origin Lite a přestřelila

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Satrapa)
articles.description: Nástup webových písem znamenal pro design stránek zásadní změnu. Do té doby byli jejich autoři odkázáni na písma instalovaná v uživatelských systémech, kterých je málo a mezi jednotlivými platformami jsou zcela nekonzistentní.
articles.title: Písma na webu: webové písmo a typografické speciality

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Budeme se opět zabývat neuronovými sítěmi. Ukážeme si změnu topologie neuronové sítě provádějící regresi, ale například i použití takzvané matice záměn (confusion matrix). Nakonec neuronovou síť naučíme malou násobilku.
articles.title: Neuronové sítě v knihovně scikit-learn (2.část)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Více než čtyři milióny zákazníků ve více než stovce zemí. Na tahle čísla dosáhla služba Starlink v roce 2024. Také to ovšem znamená více než 10 tisíc družic na orbitě Země, z nichž většina je Muskova.
articles.title: Starlink má čtyři miliony uživatelů, nebezpečně ale roste také počet družic

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Eischmann)
articles.description: Za půl roku, který uběhl od posledního vydání GNOME, udělali vývojáři mnoho práce. Nové GNOME vám umožní zvolit si systémovou barvu. GNOME Shell lépe škáluje na malých rozlišeních. Nautilus převzal roli dialogu pro výběr souboru.
articles.title: GNOME 47: vlastní nastavení barev, lepší škálování a nové dialogy

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Zmíníme se o skromných začátcích rozvoje zvukového subsystému. Tyto počítače se z kanceláří postupně rozšířily i do domácností a společně s vývojem her se i pro ně začaly vyrábět rozličné zvukové karty.
articles.title: Zvuky a hudba na platformě IBM PC

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: ČD - Telematika)
articles.description: V dnešním díle se podíváme, jak čínská auta sledují obyvatele USA, prozkoumáme islamofobní obsah na britských WiFi sítích a na závěr se zaměříme na Necro trojan a Octo2 malware na platformě Android.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: čínská auta jako nástroj sledování v USA

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Projekt Tor, který vyvíjí nástroj pro ochranu soukromí a anonymity a Tails, přenosný operační systém, spojily své síly. Projekt Arch Linux oznámil přímou spolupráci s herní společností Valve.
articles.title: Arch Linux spolupracuje s Valve, spojení projektů Tor a Tails

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Týden v KDE jako téměř definitivní finiš závodu o Plasmu 6.2, AMD a Dell i Framework chtějí zlepšit běh FreeBSD na noteboocích, energetická efektivita Xeonů Granite Rapids otestována.
articles.title: Asynchronní vypínání v Linuxu 6.12 nebude, FreeBSD poběží lépe na noteboocích

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Ve světě PC máme jediného výrobce CPU, který stojí za řeč a jediného výrobce GPU, který dominuje trhu velkých hráčských karet. Křečovitě se drží jediný správný OS, zatímco jediný správný browser si poklidně kraluje.
articles.title: Pokračující monopolizace světa PC: kdo přijde další?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Už příští víkend proběhne další ročník konference LinuxDays. Na programu pro letošní ročník najdete více než 70 přednášek a workshopů. Konference bude rozdělena do pěti sálů s různou kapacitou. Vstup na LinuxDays je jako obvykle zdarma, jen je potřeba včas vyplnit registrační formulář. Můžete si také koupit oběd, ale máte na to čas jen do pondělního poledne, protože platba na místě už pak nebude možná.
articles.title: Konference LinuxDays 2024 proběhne už příští víkend

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Místní bastlíři často hledají CO₂ senzory kvůli chytrým domům a například řízenému větrání. Stávající levné polovodičové CO₂ senzory trpí velkým driftem měřených hodnot, což se řeší periodickou autokalibrací. Ta však může být problematická, pokud nenastane při předpokládané koncentraci odpovídající venkovnímu vzduchu 400 ppm.
articles.title: Infineon PASCO2V15 CO₂ IR senzor s přesností ±50 ppm

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Prohlížeč Vivaldi 3483.4, který vyšel ve středu, má nové uživatelské rozhraní, ve kterém jsou záložky plovoucí a mohou být například kulaté. Nové jsou také ikonky a uživatel může nastavovat hustotu UI pomocí  Settings → Appearance → User Interface Density.
articles.title: Prohlížeč Vivaldi 3483.4 má nové rozhraní a startovací stránku

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: V dubnu jsme psali, jak na Raspberry Pi 5 zapnout podporu pro A2 SD karty, což zapne podporu pro Command Queueing. Karta je pak rychlejší. Nově není potřeba nic měnit a podpora sd_cqe je zapnuta pro všechny ve výchozím stavu. Pro zápis je pro jistotu vypnuta, objevovaly se totiž občas poškození souborového systému.
articles.title: Rychlejší A2 SD karty v Raspberry Pi 5 ve výchozím stavu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Zdenek Henek)
articles.description: O víkendu 5. a 6. října se koná ne-konference jOpenSpace. Pokud si chcete kouzlo živých přednášek vychutnat také, sledujte živé přenosy: sobota, neděle.
articles.title: Živé streamy z jOpenSpace 2024

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: V lednu jsme psali o tom, že projekt OpenWrt ku příležitosti 20. výročí ve spolupráci s Banana Pi připravuje vlastní otevřený hardware. Nakonec se vše podařilo a nyní se OpenWrt One/AP-24.XY dostává do prodeje. Jeho deska je založená na SoC MediaTek MT7981B (Filogic 820) a dvoupásmové čipové sadě MediaTek MT7976C WiFi 6.
articles.title: OpenWrt One/AP-24.XY je otevřený směrovač s Wi-Fi 6

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Na serveru GOG.com je možné ku příležitosti podzimních slev získat hru Whispering Willows zdarma. Jde o hororovou adventuru, kde pomáháte Eleně hledat zmizelého otce.
articles.title: Hra Whispering Willows zdarma na GOG.com

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Apache je jeden z nejrozšířenějších a nejpoužívanějších webových server současnosti, na školení Web server Apache se ho naučíme instalovat, spravovat a ladit pro co nejhladší běh našich služeb. Vše si vyzkoušíte prakticky na ostrém serveru, na kterém budete mít možnost provozovat skutečný web a ovlivňovat jeho nastavení.
articles.title: Naučte se používat web server Apache (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost Cloudflare nedávno zaznamenala nový rekordní útok DDoS, který dosáhl rychlosti 3,8 Tb/s a 2,14 miliardy paketů za sekundu (Pps). Od začátku září už prý bylo zaznamenáno více než 100 hypervolumetrických útoků DDoS na třetí nebo čtvrtou síťovou vrstvu, přičemž mnohé z nich přesáhly 2 miliardy Pps a 3 Tb/s.
articles.title: Cloudflare zaznamenal rekordní útok DDoS o rychlosti 3,8 Tb/s

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Píša)
articles.description: Nové vydání k vizualizaci zřetězeného zpracování instrukcí (pipeline) a činnosti vyrovnávacích pamětí (cache) přidává predikci skoků a její vizualizaci (Branch target Buffer, Branch History Buffer, Global History Register). Prediktor implementoval v rámci své diplomové práce Jiří Štefan.
articles.title: Vydání QtRvSim 0.9.8: grafický simulátor RISC-V pro výuku

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Na moderních počítačích s podporou video formátu AV1 – což typicky znamená desktopová či integrovaná GPU posledních generací AMD, Nvidia i Intel – nově umí Steam využívat (de)kódování video streamu do AV1 ve službě Remote Play. Teoreticky by tak na takových strojích mohl uživatel zaznamenávat vyšší kvalitu videa při stejné přenosové rychlosti.
articles.title: Steam Remote Play přidává podporu AV1 a nahrávání do H.265 s GPU

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Vilém Sládek)
articles.description: Sdružení CZ.NIC vydalo novou verzi mobilní Datovky (2.1.0). Toto vydání přináší celou řadu změn včetně vzhledu některých prvků. Dá se ale říci, že většina těchto změn je pro uživatele nepostřehnutelná. Díky těmto vylepšením by měla být nová Datovka rychlejší při používání. Datovka nyní využívá novou verzi Qt, protože společnost Google začala vynucovat API level 34.
articles.title: Nová verze Datovky přináší změny pod kapotou

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost Cisco opouští bez náhrady trh LoRaWAN pro připojení zařízení IoT. Pro uživatele nemá připravený žádný záložní nebo migrační plán. Společnost Cisco opouští oblast LoRaWAN. U bran Cisco LoRaWAN není plánována žádná migrace, uvádí jasně Cisco.
articles.title: Cisco opouští technologii LoRaWAN a pro zákazníky nemá žádný další plán

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Orgány činné v trestním řízení z 12 zemí zatkly čtyři osoby spojené s gangem okolo ransomwaru LockBit, včetně vývojáře a správce jejich zabezpečeného hostingu. Austrálie, Spojené království a Spojené státy dnes rovněž odhalily sankce proti osobě, kterou britské úřady považuje za aktivního člena skupiny LockBit napojeného na Evil Corp.
articles.title: Policie zatkla čtyři podezřelé spojené s ransomwarem LockBit

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Po patnácti letech boje za bezpečnější a přístupnější web ukončila svou činnost nadace World Wide Web Foundation. Sir Tim Berners-Lee, vynálezce World Wide Webu, a Rosemary Leithová vysvětlují, že poslání organizace bylo do jisté míry splněno a je třeba vést nové bitvy.
articles.title: Nadace World Wide Web ukončuje po patnácti letech svou činnost

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Zranitelnost s označením CVE-2024–45519 se nachází v e-mailovém serveru Zimbra, který používají především středně velké a velké organizace. Pokud správce ručně změní výchozí nastavení a povolí službu postjournal, mohou útočníci spustit příkazy odesláním škodlivě vytvořených e-mailů na adresu hostovanou na serveru.
articles.title: Poštovní server Zimbra má vážnou zranitelnost umožňující spuštění cizího kódu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: OpenVPN je kompletní implementace VPN v uživatelském prostoru. Tento přístup má velkou výhodu v přenositelnosti a jednotnosti napříč platformami, ale trpí nízkým výkonem kvůli nutnosti kopírovat data z uživatelského prostoru do jádra a zpět. V posledních několika letech vývojáři pracují na jaderném ovladači OVPN, který umožňuje zpracování dat provádět přímo v rámci jádra.
articles.title: Ovladač OpenVPN pro linuxové jádro zvyšuje výkon

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Manjaro 24.1 „Xahea“, aktuální sestavení rolující distribuce Manjaro, je venku. Jde o nové instalační obrazy od května, přinášející jak jádro řady Linux 6.10, tak aktualizované verze tří základních desktopů, dle vkusu uživatele.
articles.title: Manjaro 24.1 nabízí Linux 6.10 a k tomu GNOME 46, KDE Plasma 6.1 a Xfce 4.18

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Vývojáři desktopového prostředí Xfce upřesnili roadmapu příští verze 4.20. Ta by se měla objevit ještě před Vánoci tohoto roku, konkrétně 15. prosince. O dva týdny později, pokud by byla potřeba vydat třetí vývojové vydání.
articles.title: Xfce 4.20 možná už v prosinci

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Na serveru Root.cz funguje podporovatelský program skoro deset let. Fanouškům, kteří naší činnost takto podporují, děkujeme. Nyní mají stejnou šanci i čtenáři našeho sesterského webu Lupa.cz.
articles.title: Lupa.cz spustila podporovatelský program po vzoru sesterského serveru Root.cz

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vyšla beta verze Thunderbirdu pro Android a vývojáři prosí uživatele, aby ji pomohli otestovat. Beta testování nám pomáhá najít kritické chyby a hrubé hrany, které můžeme v následujících týdnech vypilovat, píší lidé z Mozilly na blogu. Stahovat můžete na Google Play nebo vývojářské verze na GitHubu.
articles.title: Mozilla uvolnila beta verzi Thunderbirdu pro Android

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Čerstvě vydaný FFmpeg 7.1 přináší plně nativní dekodér VVC akcelerovaný technologií Intel QSV, nový dekodér MV-HEVC, nový dekodér LC-EVC, nový dekodér xHE-AAC, filtr LCEVC, hardwarové kodéry Vulkan H.264 a H.265 a kodér D3D12VA HEVC.
articles.title: FFmpeg 7.1 se stabilním dekodérem VVC a kodérem Vulkan H.264/H.265

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Kubernetes je dnes nejrozšířenější platformou na hostovaní Docker kontejnerů a je podporován velkými hráči na trhu (Google, Amazon, Microsoft) skrz Cloud Native Computing Foundation. Kuberneres pro provoz používají všechny velikosti firem, od startupu po korporace. Pojďme se naučit jej používat na dvoudenním kurzu Úvod do Kubernetes, který proběhne v naší pražské školicí místnosti ve dnech 14. a 15. října. Školení proběhne pouze online.
articles.title: Naučte se Kubernetes na našem dvoudenním školení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost Nintendo zřejmě nakonec vyhrála svůj boj o vyřazení nejoblíbenějších emulátorů Nintendo Switch pro PC. V březnu společnost zažalovala vývojáře emulátoru Yuzu a nyní přesvědčilo i hlavního vývojáře emulátoru Ryujinx, aby odešel.
articles.title: Společnost Nintendo ukončila vývoj emulátoru Ryujinx

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vývojáři uvolnili novou verzi prohlížeče Firefox s označením 131. Umožňuje udělení dočasných oprávnění webovým stránkám, přičemž tato oprávnění mají platnost po dobu jedné hodiny nebo do zavření karty.
articles.title: Firefox 131 nabízí dočasná oprávnění pro weby a ukazuje náhledy panelů

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Kvantové provázání při dosud nejvyšší energii. Černé díry tvořené temnou hmotou by mohly ovlivňovat pohyb Marsu. Matematika a volby: Jak výsledky ovlivňuje velikost obvodu.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Kolik je ve vesmíru světla?

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Když se podíváte na takové ceny, nemůže vám uniknout velký rozdíl mezi nimi a po přístupu na oficiální kanály. Například v případě Windows 11 Pro je srovnání cen mezi €20 a €259 naprosto senzační.
articles.title: Windows 10 jen za €14, Windows 11 za €20 v podzimním výprodeji na Goodoffer24

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Konica Minolta naučila kamery vidět dovnitř výrobků. Dokážou rozpoznat správné složení léků či potravin. Konsorcium LUMI-Q podepsalo smlouvu o zřízení kvantového počítače v ČR. Každý třetí útok ransomwaru na české firmy začíná zneužitím zranitelnosti. Přínosy AI v podnikových informačních systémech. Huawei Connect 2024: Chceme budovat infrastrukturu, která obstojí v budoucnosti. Laser změní izolant na polovodič.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Konsorcium LUMI-Q podepsalo smlouvu o zřízení kvantového počítače v ČR

articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Golden: ve 2D se konečně podařilo připravit i zlato. Temná hmota mohla pomoci vytvořit supermasivní černé díry v raném vesmíru. Pozitronium ochladili téměř na absolutní nulu.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Konsorcium LUMI-Q podepsalo smlouvu o zřízení kvantového počítače v ČR

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Salesforce představuje Agentforce – AI nástroj pro budoucnost zákaznických služeb. Novinky v MSP platformě Acronis: Copilot a automatizované postupy odezvy. Třetina firem v ČR má téměř nulovou míru digitalizace. Objevili nový materiál pro opticky řízenou magnetickou paměť.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Třetina firem v ČR má téměř nulovou míru digitalizace

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Supravodivost: Popsali bohatý svět hydridů yttria. Supravodič zesílený magnetismem. Pro supravodivost hydridů by mohl být klíčový také cer. Dnešní podobu Sluneční soustavy mohla zformovat další hvězda.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Podařilo se vytvořit otisk zrcadel do superfotonu

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Když vidíte podobné ceny, při srovnání nákupu softwaru na oficiálních kanálech s Goodoffer24 se při tak velkém rozdílu nemůžete splést. Například u Windows 11 Pro je srovnání naprosto úžasné, protože srovnáváte částku €20 s tradiční cenou €259.

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Chytré kamery umí předejít útokům se zbraní. Útočníka odhalí i v davu. Umělá inteligence pohání rostoucí investice do cloudových služeb PaaS a IaaS. Platforma RHEL AI podpoří podnikové inovace. AI patří i na notebooky. Bezserverová architektura není všelékem.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Bezserverová architektura není všelékem

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová verze 8.8 multiplatformní digitální pracovní stanice pro práci s audiem (DAW) Ardour. Přehled oprav, vylepšení a novinek v oficiálním oznámení.
articles.title: Ardour 8.8

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová major verze 11.0.0 nástroje mitmproxy určeného pro vytváření interaktivních MITM proxy pro HTTP a HTTPS komunikaci. Přehled novinek v příspěvku na blogu. Vypíchnuta je plná podpora HTTP/3 a vylepšená podpora DNS.
articles.title: Mitmproxy 11.0.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Richard Hughes na svém blogu představil nejnovější major verzi 2.0.0 nástroje fwupd umožňujícího aktualizovat firmware zařízení na počítačích s Linuxem. Podrobný přehled novinek v poznámkách k vydání. Přehled podporovaných zařízení, nejnovějších firmwarů a zapojených výrobců na stránkách LVFS (Linux Vendor Firmware Service).
articles.title: fwupd 2.0.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Počítačová hra Kvark (Steam) od studia Perun Creative dospěla do verze 1.0 (𝕏). Běží také na Linuxu.
articles.title: Počítačová hra Kvark dospěla do verze 1.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána (𝕏) zářijová aktualizace aneb nová verze 1.94 editoru zdrojových kódů Visual Studio Code (Wikipedie). Přehled novinek i s náhledy a animovanými gify v poznámkách k vydání. Ve verzi 1.94 vyjde také VSCodium, tj. komunitní sestavení Visual Studia Code bez telemetrie a licenčních podmínek Microsoftu.
articles.title: Visual Studio Code a VSCodium 1.94

articles.author: Zdenek H.
articles.description: O víkendu 5. a 6. října se koná ne-konference jOpenSpace. Pokud si chcete kouzlo živých přednášek vychutnat společně s námi, sledujte live streamy: sobota a neděle. Začínáme lehce po 9 hodině ranní. Zpracované záznamy jsou obvykle k dispozici do 14 dní na našem YouTube kanále.
articles.title: Živé streamy z jOpenSpace 2024

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Hodiny s unixovým časem dnes odbily 20 000 dnů. Unixový čas je počet sekund uplynulých od půlnoci 1. ledna 1970. Dnes ve 02:00 to bylo 1 728 000 000 sekund, tj. 20 000 dnů.
articles.title: Hodiny s unixovým časem odbily 20 000 dnů

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Notebook NitroPad V56 od společnosti Nitrokey byl oficiálně certifikován pro Qubes OS verze 4. Qubes OS (Wikipedie) je svobodný a otevřený operační systém zaměřený na bezpečnost desktopu.
articles.title: Notebook NitroPad V56 certifikován pro Qubes OS 4

articles.author: Fluttershy, yay!
articles.description: Multiplatformní hororová adventura Whispering Willows je na portále GOG.com zdarma, akce trvá do 6. října.
articles.title: Hra Whispering Willows na GOG zdarma

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Na čem aktuálně pracují vývojáři webového prohlížeče Ladybird (GitHub)? Byl publikován přehled vývoje za září (YouTube).
articles.title: Vývoj webového prohlížeče Ladybird (09/2024)

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: It's been a long journey to see good web camera support for Intel Alder Lake and newer designs making use of the IPU6 imaging IP. But with Fedora 41 due for release in the coming weeks, there will finally be good out-of-the-box, open-source support for the IPU6-based web cameras in modern Intel Core laptops across Tigerlake / Alder Lake / Raptor Lake laptops...
articles.title: Fedora 41 Has Working Intel IPU6 Web Camera Support With Modern Laptops

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: We are not done yet seeing new Arm cores still impacted by the Speculative Store Bypass handling errata. Merged to Linux 6.12 on Friday was adding the speculative SSBS workaround for the Cortex-A715, Neoverse-N3, and Microsoft Azure Cobalt 100 cores...
articles.title: Linux 6.12 Patches Neoverse-N3 & Microsoft Azure Cobalt 100 For Speculative SSBS

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: OpenZFS 2.3-rc1 is now available for testing as the next major feature release to this open-source ZFS file-system implementation for Linux and FreeBSD systems...
articles.title: OpenZFS 2.3-rc1 Delivers RAIDZ Expansion, Fast Dedup & Direct IO

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Sam Lantinga released SDL 3.1.3 on Friday as their "stable ABI preview" version ahead of the SDL 3.2.0 stable release. The developer at Valve notes that SDL3 has already been "battle tested by millions of people in DOTA, CS2 and Steam" and they are now gearing up for the SDL 3.2 stable release to get SDL3 out to the masses...
articles.title: SDL 3.1.3 Stable ABI Preview Release

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: KDE developers have been putting the finishing touches on the Plasma 6.2 desktop as it prepares to release next week. Plasma 6.2 will be out on Tuesday barring any last minute issues...
articles.title: KDE Plasma 6.2 Preparing For Release Next Week

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: We are quickly working our way to the end of the calendar year where Wine 9.xx bi-weekly development releases will focus on a shift to stability for releasing Wine 10.0 in early 2025. But we're not there yet and Wine 9.19 is out today to deliver the newest batch of features and fixes for this open-source software to enjoy Windows games and apps on Linux...
articles.title: Wine 9.19 Brings Improved Window Positioning On Wayland

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Qualcomm Cloud AI 100 accelerator caters to a variety of edge-to-cloud industries. While the Qualcomm Cloud AI hardware isn't talked about as much as the AI accelerators from other vendors, there is the QAIC driver within the mainline Linux kernel for supporting the Cloud AI 100 along with associated open-source compiler and user-space stack. It turns out the Qualcomm Cloud AI family is growing with a Cloud AI 80 "AIC080" accelerator coming to market at a lower-cost...
articles.title: Qualcomm Linux Driver Prepares For New "AIC080" Lower-Cost Cloud AI Accelerator

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel's Linux engineers continue working on preparing for next-generation hardware support within the kernel well ahead of launch. The latest on the recent enablement around next-gen Panther Lake processors is enabling a new "5th Gen" neural processing unit (NPU) to be found with Panther Lake P...
articles.title: Intel Panther Lake Introducing 5th Gen NPU - Initial Linux Patches Posted

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Earlier this week I delivered initial Intel Xe2 Lunar Lake graphics benchmarks on Linux while today the focus is on Lunar Lake's CPU performance. The Xe2 graphics performance under Linux was disappointingly slow with it performing even worse than Meteor Lake while RDNA3.5 graphics led. Intel has been investigating the Xe2 Linux graphics performance but I haven't heard any updates yet. Today the attention is on the Lunar Lake CPU side under Linux and it too isn't looking too good. The performance of this 8-core Core Ultra 7 256V SoC is poor in real-world multi-threaded scenarios and the performance-per-Watt is only compelling in a subset of workloads. The AMD Ryzen AI 9 365 and AMD Ryzen AI 9 HX 370 Zen 5 SoCs tended to deliver the superior performance and power efficiency under Linux.
articles.title: AMD Ryzen AI 300 Series Dominates Intel Core Ultra 7 Lunar Lake Performance For Linux Developers & Creators

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The open-source ZLUDA project began life as a drop-in CUDA replacement that ran atop Intel GPUs using the Level Zero API. Then AMD quietly began funding it for several years as a viable CUDA implementation running atop AMD GPUs until discontinued funding earlier this year. ZLUDA for AMD GPUs was then made open-source but then in August the ZLUDA code was removed at AMD's request. Today it's taking on its third incarnation...
articles.title: ZLUDA Takes On Third Life: Open-Source Multi-GPU CUDA Implementation Focused On AI

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Richard Hughes of Red Hat just announced Fwupd 2.0 as a major release to this open-source firmware updating utility for Linux systems. Fwupd 2.0 clears out a lot of long deprecated and legacy bits while adding new features and shipping many fixes...
articles.title: Fwupd 2.0 Released To Drop Legacy & Deprecated Bits, Adds New Features

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Blender 4.3 is available today in beta form to encourage public testing of this next feature release to this leading open-source 3D modeling software...
articles.title: Blender 4.3 Beta Delivers Experimental Vulkan UI Rendering

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Red Hat engineer Jocelyn Falempe has been working to sort out DRM Panic support for the AMDGPU driver. The DRM Panic infrastructure is useful since it's what allows presenting a panic screen, a.k.a. a "Blue Screen of Death" type experience when running into major kernel problems. With Linux 6.12 there's now the ability to show QR codes for error messages with DRM Panic...
articles.title: Red Hat Engineer Working On DRM Panic Support For AMDGPU Driver

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Zink OpenGL-on-Vulkan driver has experimental code now available for testing that also implements the Video Acceleration API (VA-API) atop the Vulkan Video APIs. This is an interesting effort that now allows VA-API applications to rely on drivers with Vulkan Video support underneath...
articles.title: Zink Seeing VA-API Video Acceleration Implemented Over Vulkan Video

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Zrythm is an interesting open-source digital audio workstation (DAW) software package. It's been making use of the GTK toolkit but now the developers have decided to switch to Qt6 instead...
articles.title: Zrythm Digital Audio Workstation Abandoning GTK For Qt6

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Rust-written Servo web layout engine project that was born at Mozilla and now continued by Linux Foundation Europe with other stakeholders like Igalia has been making steady progress in recent months. The project's September 2024 status report is now available that outlines recent improvements to this open-source browser layout engine...
articles.title: Servo Browser Adds Android Downloads, Improved Tabbing & More

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: A new set of patches from AMD Linux engineers today aim to boost the performance for heterogeneous CPU designs such as the recent Ryzen AI 300 "Strix Point" SoCs that have multiple core types...
articles.title: New AMD Linux Patches Aim To Further Boost Performance For Heterogeneous CPU Designs

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Last week when kicking off the Intel Granite Rapids benchmarking with the Xeon 6980P processors there was particularly strong performance within HPC and other scientific computing workloads. Besides going now up to 128 cores / 256 threads per socket, another reason for the especially strong generational uplift and against the current AMD EPYC competition is Xeon 6 Granite Rapids introducing Multiplexed Rank memory support. One of the areas I've been eager to explore is quantifying the DDR5-6400 vs. MRDIMM 8800MT/s performance difference and this article is dedicated to looking at that memory performance impact for the Xeon 6900P series.
articles.title: MRDIMM 8800MT/s vs. DDR5-6400 Memory Performance With Intel Xeon 6

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Last week with the launch of the Intel Xeon 6900P "Granite Rapids" processors, Intel didn't disclose their list prices... Today they added the Granite Rapids list prices to their ARK database. With Granite Rapids making Intel much more competitive to the AMD EPYC competition and over prior generation Xeon CPUs, these new processors are commanding a higher price tag with the Xeon 6980P topping out at $17,800 USD...
articles.title: Intel Xeon 6900P "Granite Rapids" List Prices Top Out At $17,800 USD

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Mesa 24.2.4 is out today as the newest stable point release to this collection of predominantly OpenGL and Vulkan open-source drivers...
articles.title: Mesa 24.2.4 Released With Many OpenGL & Vulkan Driver Fixes

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Now that sched_ext was upstreamed into the mainline Linux kernel as part of the many great features in Linux 6.12, Fedora's kernel builds are prepared to enable this innovative scheduler feature that allows for new scheduling policies to be loaded via (e)BPF programs...
articles.title: Fedora's Kernel Build Now Enabling Sched_Ext Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Google engineers have been working on support for the Linux kernel to leverage AutoFDO feedback directed optimizations and Propeller optimizations when compiling the Linux kernel with LLVM/Clang. In turn this can help Linux systems see 2~10% better performance thanks to the more optimized kernel...
articles.title: Google Updates Patches For AutoFDO+Propeller Optimized Linux Kernel

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: After years of AmpereComputing talking about AmpereOne AArch64 server processors, it looks like we are finally on the cusp of seeing broader availability of the processors and servers/motherboards for this ARM server platform up to 192 cores. At the end of August I finally received a temporary review system with the AmpereOne A192-32X flagship SKU. That server was the Supermicro ARS-211M-NR and is supposed to be seeing availability real soon. Now the latest on the AmpereOne front is Giga Computing (Gigabyte) announcing general availability of their servers...
articles.title: Giga Computing Announces GA On Their AmpereOne Servers

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: NetworkManager 1.50 released on Wednesday as the newest version of this software commonly used on the Linux desktop for managing wired and wireless network connections...
articles.title: NetworkManager 1.50 Released - Now Ensures Offensive Terms Don't Appear In Settings

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Unified Acceleration Foundation (UXL Foundation), which was formed out of Intel's oneAPI software efforts, will be hosting a virtual developer summit...
articles.title: UXL Foundation Hosting Virtual oneAPI DevSummit 2024 Next Week

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Steam's Remote Play feature that allows playing Steam games on phones / tablets / TVs / other PCs while streamed from your main gaming system now is able to handle AV1 video streaming...
articles.title: Steam Remote Play Adds AV1 Video Streaming Support Plus More Linux Fixes

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: If you have been trying out Linux 6.12-rc1 or a recent Linux Git snapshot and discovered your laptop's touchpad is no longer working, you are far from alone. The good news is the issue has been quickly tracked down and has led to a new input driver being reverted...
articles.title: Linux 6.12 Drops New Driver That Ended Up Breaking Laptop Touchpad Support For Many Users

articles.author: Michael Larabel

articles.description:
Dan Da Dan is making waves as one of the most exciting new anime in the Fall 2024 lineup. Combining supernatural elements with intense action and a dash of humor, the series has quickly gained attention for its quirky plot and fast-paced energy. Fans of the manga have been eagerly awaiting the anime adaptation, and now, it’s finally here.


Full release schedule


The anime kicked off on October 3, 2024, and is available on Crunchyroll. Although there is still no official confirmation of the final number of episodes, the season is expected to have a total of 12 episodes. For those looking to follow the series closely, here’s the full release schedule:



Episode 1 release date: October 3, 2024


Episode 2 release date: October 10, 2024


Episode 3 release date: October 17, 2024


Episode 4 release date: October 24, 2024


Episode 5 release date: October 31, 2024


Episode 6 release date: November 7, 2024


Episode 7 release date: November 14, 2024


Episode 8 release date: November 21, 2024


Episode 9 release date: November 28, 2024


Episode 10 release date: December 5, 2024


Episode 11 release date: December 12, 2024


Episode 12 release date: December 19, 2024



The series follows two high school students, Ken Takakura and Momo Ayase, who are constantly debating which is more real — Momo’s belief in the occult or Ken’s fascination with aliens. Their rivalry takes a bizarre twist when both of their beliefs turn out to be true, plunging them into a chaotic world of spirits and aliens.


As if things weren’t weird enough, Ken suddenly finds himself cursed and missing a very personal part of his anatomy. Now, with the stakes quite literally close to home, he and Momo must work together to recover Ken’s “family jewels” while navigating a bizarre mix of the paranormal and extraterrestrial.


This article will be updated with any new developments.

The post Dan Da Dan full release schedule appeared first on Destructoid.

articles.author: Daniel Morris
articles.description:
File this under "news no one expected." 343 Industries has confirmed that Halo Infinite is getting a third-person mode, and it's coming sooner than you think, with a release date penned in for November.


Halo historians will know that Combat Evolved was a third-person shooter at one point in its development. Now, well over two decades later, that idea is set to become a reality in Halo Infinite.


Image via 343 Industries


Halo Infinite third-person mode confirmed


343 Industries confirmed the addition of third-person mode to Halo Infinite in a video on Twitter. It's an announcement that wouldn't feel out of place on April Fools' Day. Halo? Third-person?! I assure you, it's real, and frankly, it looks like a lot of fun.


The clips from the gameplay were marked as a work in progress, but a couple of interesting tidbits can be garnered from what has been shown so far.




One moment shows the player transitioning from first to third-person, indicating that you're not locked into one view for the entire match. It remains to be seen if the new third-person view is only available in specific modes. PvE combat was also shown, confirming Firefight will be getting the third-person treatment. Count me in. 


Interestingly, the footage features one moment involving the player struggling to see while entering a Shroud Screen. This shows the drawback of adding third-person to a game not initially designed for it, so it'll be interesting to see how 343 Industries handles things like this in the full release.


Even if third-person mode doesn't become the de-facto way to play Halo Infinite going forward, I'd be lying if I said I wasn't intrigued to try it out. It's currently set for a November release, with no specific date nailed down at the moment.

The post Halo Infinite is getting a third-person mode next month appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Halo Infinite is getting a third-person mode next month

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
Like every MMO, playing with your friends is a key aspect of enjoying Throne and Liberty's gameplay.


Of course, you can play with strangers and make new mates online, but the game also lets you play together with your friends (as long as the two of you are on the same server). In terms of available activities, there's plenty of freedom over what you want to do together. Unfortunately, your inventory can't be shared with your friend, and NCSoft's latest adventure is very strict about this.


Throne and Liberty trading with friends explained


When you participate in a quest with your friend, any rewards will be split equally. In fact, Throne and Liberty does have a player-driven economy where you can use your auctioning skills. But when it comes to trading between your friends, that's simply not possible.


The situation could change in the future if the developers decide to tweak how the existing system works. However, I hardly see that happening as NCSoft has already introduced the Auction House.




How does Auction House work in Throne and Liberty?


The Auction House allows you to trade your items and gears. To do that, you'll need a particular currency called the Lucent (this currency can be earned by simply playing the game). If you're looking for a specific piece of gear, you'll find it in the Auction House. Similarly, you can sell a gear that you don't need and earn Lucent in the process.


Please note that the Auction House is a work in progress as of this writing, and some major changes could be made to the system in the future. A direct trading system, on the other hand, could lead to unfair practices like botting. Moreover, it could also incentivize people to hoard their loot and ask for unexpected prices. All things considered, the presence of a universal Auction House is certainly a better trade-off.

The post Throne and Liberty: Can you trade with friends? appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Throne and Liberty: Can you trade with friends?

Halloween has begun, but in order to actually start the event, you'll have to put in some effort first. Check out where to find the Halloween NPC in Type Soul and do some ghostbusting.


How to find the Halloween NPC in Type Soul - Location


In order to find the Halloween NPC called the Mystery Witch in the Type Soul Halloween update, you have to go to Karakura Town. If you're not already there, just use your Senkaimon to spawn in the town. The goal is to go down, but the easiest way I orient myself (since I will get lost in one room, let alone a map as large as this one) is by heading to the Trader first. 


The Trader is located on the balcony right across from Binders Bakery. There is a large tree and a pumpkin in this area so you can't miss it. Once you are there, jump over the fence next to the pumpkin and keep going diagonally to the left until you reach the edge. Now, go along the fence until you find an opening, then keep heading to the right.


Image by Destructoid


Image by Destructoid


Image by Destructoid








When you are down to the lowest level, look for the purple sign with a bottle and numbers on it. The NPC is hiding in this alley right in the corner. Getting to the Mystery Witch is quite a hassle since you have to climb so far down, but it's worth it for the ability to fight off the ghosts. 


Image by Destructoid


Interact with the Mystery Witch Halloween NPC to start the Halloween event. You'll have to defeat ghosts in: 



Hueco Mundo


Soul Society 


Wanden


Karakura



When interacting with the Mystery Witch, you can also open the Halloween shop with plenty of items which you can purchase for points that you get from completing the quest. 


That's all there is to starting the Halloween event in Type Soul. If you are looking for more information, you can check out the Type Soul section here on Destructoid.

articles.description:
In the new Bleach-inspired Roblox game Paradox, you choose from three different Races each with their own different progression paths and evolutions. As you progress through various evolutions, others get locked out, making it important that you pre-plan and pick the right race. We've put together this Paradox Race Tier List so you know right from character creation what to work towards.


Screenshot by Destructoid


Paradox Race Tier List for all Unlocks and Evolutions (Launch Version)


All three races in Paradox have unique evolution paths, with ultimate pinnacle evolutions. Keep in mind, you cannot change your race once selected. These are typically the strongest options in Paradox (and are therefore in S Tier). Those in the A Tier are solid options to go into if you don't want to put in the grind for the S Tier evolutions. Those in the B Tier are typically the base versions of each Race, while those in the C Tier are reserved for the two side evolutions for Hollow. You won't stay as these evolutions for long, as they are very weak, but are intended as a challenge before evolving into the next variation. Here is our Paradox Race Tier List for every form of evolution and unlock for all of the Races at the time of launch:


S Tier



Ressurection Arrancar (Hollow Evolution)


Schrift Quincy (Quincy Unlock)


Vizard (Shinigami Unlock)



A Tier



Arrancar (Hollow Evolution)


Shikai (Shinigami Unlock)


Quincy (Base Quincy)



B Tier



Adjuchas (Hollow Evolution)


Soul Reaper (Base Shinigami)


Vasto Lorde (Hollow Evolution)



C Tier



Fishbone (Hollow Evolution)


Menos (Hollow Evolution)



As you can see, Soul Reaper, Hollow, and Quincy all have an unlock or evolution that makes them S Tier. In Paradox, you can typically choose which of the three races' playstyle caters to you the most, then focus on their S tier unlock or evolution as you progress through the game while getting strong along the way.

The post Paradox Race Tier List appeared first on Destructoid.

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
Nature's Jade is arguably one of the hardest resources in Throne and Liberty if you consider the rate at which they drop inside the game.


Nature's Jade is strictly linked with the activity of fishing, and it's beneficial if you're looking to upgrade your equipment. But to do so, you'll first have to find the resources in the required quantities. Unlike some of the more commonly available resources, you could end up getting confused trying to find Nature's Jade if you don't know where to look.


How to get Nature's Jade in Throne and Liberty


There are three ways to get Nature's Jade within the game. They're available from Small and Big Catch Sacks.


You can get these sacks in the same way as you get fish/treasures. There's no guarantee when you'll get these sacks. So far for me, getting a sack seems to happen randomly. Small is the most common one, and I am yet to get a Big Catch.


When you get one of these sacks, there's no guarantee that there will be Nature's Jade in it. In fact, the odds of finding other resources are higher in most cases.


Screenshot by Destructoid


How to use Nature's Jade in Throne and Liberty


This particular resource is exclusively tied to fishing activity, as it helps you to upgrade your rods. Once you have enough Jade, go to Sundries Merchant (which can be found in different towns). By interacting with him, you'll be able to get the upgraded rods. For example, the Bamboo Fishing Rod can be upgraded to a Steel Fishing Rod in exchange for 10 Nature's Jade.


Additionally, you can also get the Tevent Fishing Rod by exchanging Tevent's Soul Fragment. But do note that you'll need 100 Jade for this, so it can be pretty expensive. But investing your resources has some merit, as better rods will improve your fishing. I also believe that the better rods have higher chances of finding a sack, so consider the expense as an investment.

The post Throne and Liberty: How to get Nature’s Jade appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Throne and Liberty: How to get Nature’s Jade
